definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
to open/to start/to initiate/to enlighten or awaken/to state/to inform
Qi son of Yu the Great 禹[Yu3], reported founder of the Xia Dynasty 夏朝[Xia4 Chao2] (c. 2070-c. 1600 BC)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Save the mediation module and restart it.
sentences.chinese: 保存中介模块，并重新启动它。

sentences.english: The number of reactivations is growing.
sentences.chinese: 重新启动的数目持续增加中。
无法重新启动印表机伺服器。

sentences.english: You need to restart Application Server to pick up this change.
sentences.chinese: 您需要重新启动应用服务器才能使此更改生效。

sentences.english: You need to restart the project in the server.
sentences.chinese: 您需要重新启动服务器中项目。

sentences.english: Validate the configuration in each of the gateways, and restart the application servers.
sentences.chinese: 在每个网关中验证配置，然后重新启动应用服务器。

sentences.english: My business got jump-started by my "circle of friends".
sentences.chinese: 我的业务得到重新启动，由我的“朋友圈”。

sentences.english: If the process is terminated, do not restart it.
sentences.chinese: 如果进程终止，则不重新启动它。

sentences.english: Description:NSPI Proxy can contact Global Catalog GCName but it does not support the NSPI service.
sentences.chinese: 如果您重新启动全局编录服务器，并不能修复该问题。

sentences.english: Let the node reboot, and installation starts.
sentences.chinese: 让节点重新启动，开始安装。

sentences.english: Merrill has also revitalised its trainee programme, it said.
sentences.chinese: 美林表示，公司还重新启动了实习生计划。

sentences.english: To do so, you need to first restart the application.
sentences.chinese: 要完成此操作，首先需要重新启动应用程序。

sentences.english: Now reboot and check the result.
sentences.chinese: 现在重新启动并检查结果。

sentences.english: You need to re-boot the machine.
sentences.chinese: 你需要重新启动一下这个机器。

sentences.english: Reboot and try to log into your new account.
sentences.chinese: 然后重新启动，再试试用你的新账户登录。

sentences.english: The updates will not be fully installed until you restart your computer.
sentences.chinese: 重新启动计算机后更新才会完全安装。

definition: to start (a machine)/(fig.) to set in motion/to launch (an operation)/to activate (a plan)
out of order (of machine)/not working properly/a failing (of a system)
to cease/to suspend/to break off/to stop/to discontinue
to crash (of a computer)/Taiwanese term for 當機|当机[dang4 ji1]
